headline: Wine-Braised Beef Brisket
description: Tender beef brisket roasts for hours until tender in an easy, savory sauce flavored with tomato and red wine.

video.description: See how to make this tasty slow-cooked beef brisket.
video.name: Wine-Braised Beef Brisket

name: Wine-Braised Beef Brisket

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix thyme, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl and rub the mixture over both sides of brisket.
Heat olive oil in a roasting pan over medium-high heat; place brisket in the hot oil and brown on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove brisket from pan and set aside.
Place red onion slices into the hot roasting pan and cook and stir until onion is slightly softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in beef broth, tomato sauce, and wine.
Place the brisket back into the roasting pan and cover pan with foil.

Roast the brisket in the preheated oven for 1 hour; remove foil and baste brisket with pan juices. Place foil back over roasting pan and roast brisket until very tender and pan sauce has thickened, 1 1/2 to 2 more hours.

review.reviewBody: I wanted to cook it all day because I had the time, so I set it on 300 for several hours. I didn't have thyme (no pun intended) so I used a little rosemary, not much. But overall the taste is great and I can't wait for the kids to try it, it is like butter!
Excellent recipe. I added an extra onion because we love onions and a little more red wine because I used tomato paste. Didn't have a small can of tomato sauce. I will make this again.

Outstanding! Made it almost exactly as written. Instead of a can of tomato sauce I used a healthy squeeze from a tube of tomato paste. Cooked it in a dutch oven, covered for half the cook, uncovered to finish.

I needed to double this recipe. I made it as is the day before serving it. After 7 hours on LOW in the slow cooker, (the next day) I transferred the meat into a large roasting pan on top of about 8 thick mushroom slices, 1 c. of sliced garlic and another onion, sliced. I then covered everything with 6 shallots (sliced)and all the liquid from the slow cooker. I roasted covered/then uncovered at 350F for 1.5 hours. Interesting note: even the tiny bit of added mushroom added a lovely flavor. That said, next time I will add a carrot for added sweetness and complexity. My discerning French in-Laws were singing my praises for days. Thanks for this recipe!
Great recipe. Made it many times!

This was my first brisket ever and I made it exactly as written. My BF who is an excellent cook told me, after I'd put the brisket in the oven, that it was something that needed to cook slowly all afternoon. :O I was certain I'd ruined a meal considering this recipe says about 2.5 hours. Well, 90 minutes after I had it in the oven it was done, tender, juicy and delicious! My teen son even had multiple helpings because he liked it so much. :) So, this cooking novice thanks you for this recipe. Out of curiosity I may cook it 'low and slow' next time just to see if there is a difference but not because it's needed. Also, the sauce is fantastic!

After living in Texas for 11 years I like to smoke brisket, nance I haven’t made it in oven in years. I’m not a fan of thyme and so I used a rub from a famous Austin BBQ restaurant instead of making the one in the recipe. I cooked in a Dutch Oven and added sliced carrots the last hour. This was amazing!! Thank you for posting.
We have never been able to make brisket to our liking. This recipe is a keeper and we just made it again. Smells like Julia Child’s Boef Bourgogne! We love it!
First time making beef brisket. Excellent gravy. I’ll definitely make again.
This was only ok. Not worth the many hours of cooking.
Amazing! I have cooked this for a crowd of 100 and it turned out perfect!
This is perfect just the way it is! We will be making it again.

I made this hearty recipe for Christmas Dinner, and it was Yummy! We all loved it! I pan to keep this wonderful recipe for other occasions. Dee-lish! Thank you.
Veronica James
Made this last week and followed directions exactly as written. A must try. This definitely part of our go to line up now.

I followed the recipe as written except for some added garlic. The red wine I chose was Merlot. I used the wine to deglaze my pan and capture all of the flavors. The recipe was fantastic! I cooked the brisket an hour longer than the recipe required (maybe my oven) and it was wonderfully tender. The wine and seasonings gave the gravy so much depth of flavor which I loved so I recommend doubling the gravy to use with a side of your choice. This was my first time making brisket and I appreciate you sharing the recipe!
Excellent

Its an excellent recipe for a non-bbq experience. This was a big hit at Thanksgiving dinner. The only thing I would recommend is using low sodium broth because when you thicken up the sauce, the saltiness goes up quite a bit. Otherwise, it will be my goto recipe for years to come.
First time I've ever made a brisket and it was perfection! Can't wait to make it again. Followed the recipe exactly.
I made this pretty much exactly as written. It got rave reviews from hubby and my adult sons! Definitely will make it again!
I didn't make any changes and this was really good. I recommend making more than you'll eat the first night because, like others said, it is better the second!
This is very easy and delicious. I used my Dutch oven and it was perfect. One of my husband
Easy to make! Excellent taste! Drink the leftover wine with the meal ;). Perfect for a rainy day at home.

I don't like to drink red wine, but I do occasionally use it in sauces, so this recipe intrigued. I made it for company, so crossed my fingers. It was delish! We are both on low-sodium diets, so I swapped 1 Tbsp salt with 2 Tbsp of Mrs Dash Table Blend, and used no salt-added bone broth and tomato sauce. Still great! The wine adds body and flavor, without overwhelming. As others suggested, I made it a day ahead, sliced the roast, and returned it the pan, and covered it with sauce before refrigerating. The next day I brought it back to room temperature, then reheated at 200° for an hour. Perfection.
I followed the recipe exactly. It was okay, but not spectacular. The meat was tender, but the seasoning was a little lacking for me. The rest of the family agreed.

This recipe is fantastic! I made it last night as directed with one exception. I used angus beef stew meat because the grocer was out of brisket. Therefore, I cooked on the stove top for an hour in lieu of roasting. My family kept complimenting me on the meal. I served with grilled lemon asparagus spears, tricolor pearl quinoa and crusty bread. The plate was colorfully appealing!

This recipe is fantastic! My stepdaughter said it was the best brisket I've ever made. My husband said O...My...God. My MIL said it was sooooo delicious with a big grin on her face. That makes this recipe worth its weight in gold.
Made this exactly as shown. Just outstanding.

Okay, I made an almost 7 lb brisket for a dinner party of 5 and didnt have as much left over as I expected. I used Tempranillo Merlot for the wine and yellow onion and also sprinkled it with a “Burgundy Pepper” seasoning I bought at the farmers market. I seared it as they suggested and then started it in my 200 degree roaster for an hour or a little less (bc I was baking a pie in my oven) before transferring it to a large double grill pan, covered it in aluminum foil and baked it at 350 for another 2 hours and 15 min then let it rest a half hour before peeling off the foil and slicing it on my cutting board and placing it back into the juices and recovering w foil and served it about 40 minutes later. It was the best brisket I have ever made and all my guests raved about it. I normally do brisket a little more BBQ in style but this is much more sophisticated than that and more tender. Leftovers have been incredible also. I give this high marks, but definitely use a high end merlot or merlot blend!
Made it exactly as recipe described. It was excellent.

My very first beef brisket- mainly because our family eats little to no red meat- but I had tasted someone’s brisket at a party and wanted to try it- what a smashing success- wouldn’t even think of looking for a different recipe- easily made and perfect outcome- had to tell my grandsons it was a different kind of chicken ( as they didn’t want to ‘try’ meat!) and they gave me two thumbs up! Added sautéed mushrooms to gravy just because....I will likely serve it over the holidays as something different!
Wow, is this good. Have made a lot of Brisket, this recipe is a keeper. I seared the meat in an oval enameled cast iron Dutch Oven then just popped it into the oven with the lid on.
Very moist and flavorful. Will definitely make again.
Amazing flavor! Will do this many times in the future! Yum!

My first time cooking brisket and we loved it. I had two smaller pieces that made 3 lbs. I cooked this in my trusty cast iron casserole. The flavour was simple and rich. The meat was tender and just right. We had fries with it but next time mashed potatoes for sure. I added 1/2 teaspoon msg, any will try salt free broth as it was almost too salty.

My husband made this and it was absolutely delicious. The only change was he used a yellow onion instead of red because that's what we had on hand, and he added garlic. It's a great recipe for a dutch oven. We'll be making this again.
This is ridiculously good. The meat is juicy and flavorful. My husband said he thinks we should offer to make the brisket at the next Seder.
Perfect! Was five stars from the whole family. This is a keeper in our house! Thanks!
Definitely 5 stars!!!! I’m making this for Memorial Day and shred instead of slicing it!!
It was delish, everyone loved it.
Simple recipe and it came out perfect . Tasted the same as when I ate the braised beef in a restaurant in Dallas Texas .

Very good! I’m glad I read through some reviews because I was thinking 2.5 hours at 350 seemed wrong, but it does work beautifully! I added a few extra spices to our taste, but for the most part followed the recipe as directed. Solid brisket recipe. My husband went back for seconds. Looking forward to the leftovers.

Made this over the weekend with a 14lb brisket, multiplied the recipe by 4, I did add Garlic Powder to the spice rub. Put the rub on Friday and then cooked it Saturday night for Sunday. Everyone loved it. Said it was the Best of the 3 main dishes there.
Did not use the onion due to dietary restrictions. We all liked it, the beef was tender. I could only find a 2.15 lb. brisket, after browning it in my dutch oven I put it in the oven for 2.5 hours.
I added minced garlic, a lot as per other reviews. It had good flavor, but wasn't as tender as I expected. I will try it again.

Tender and tasted, so amazing, my son inlaw wanted to drink the sauce! I will definitely keep this recipe. I made just as is, served it up with a baguette (to soak up the tasty juices)and garlic mash. Dan
We love it. Made it a few times!

I will definitely prepare this again. Turned out tender and delicious, made it the night before serving, sliced it and placed meat back in the gravy filled pan overnight. I might use a little less wine next time, just personal preference. I followed recipe without any changes.
The dish turned out to be delicious. I might try to slow cook it in a crockpot next time and see how it turns out.
came out really tender and great flavor will make again

This was better than I thought it would be. Instead of brisket, I used 1 1/2 pounds of chuck roast (since it was all I had). Also, I substituted vegetable broth for the red wine. I seared the meat and made the gravy in a deep dish skillet on the stove. Then I poured the contents into a roasting pan and put it in the oven for 50 minutes. After basting, I returned the meat to the oven for one hour. My roast was tender and delicious. The tomato sauce added that extra flavor that made this dinner really good. I served it with mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli. The gravy tasted great on potatoes.

I made this with a lean cut of chuck roast cut into portions, and slashed the tops to rub in garlic mixture, reduced the red wine by 1/3 cup and cooked in a slow cooker 6 hours. Served over Parmesan creamy polenta and though quite peppery, wonderful flavor. Served with sliced carrots which I had added in the last 30 minutes to the crockpot. I think sliced mushrooms would also add to this dish. Will definitely make again!
Want to make this for Christmas dinner. How many does this recipe serve?

Delicious and fork tender. A go to recipe for brisket. For 5 lb brisket I substituted small can tomato paste for tomato sauce and used 1 14 1/2 ounce can of chicken broth as that was what I had on hand. I increased the wine to 3/4 cup, increased the seasoning slightly and added an extra onion to compensate for the larger size.

WOW!! So good - the only regret I have is, I bought a 4 pound briskit and cut off about a pound to store in the freezer. I should have just cooked all of it, I don't have nearly the leftovers I was hoping for!! I suggest preparing it exactly as written, it is really delicious.
Easy and delicious!
I made this exactly as the recipe said. It was tender but not falling apart, so it was easy to slice. I took a test taste and said OMG, this is sooo good! This is a keeper.
I made this dish. The meat got so tender and moist If I had one thing to change it would be placing the meat on a rack with more basting.
Used this recipe to make my first brisket this Easter. Followed the recipe and it turned out great. Will do this again!!
This was yummy. I added a bit of rosemary and garlic as well. Definitely even better the next day! I also cut up a little of the cold leftovers and added them to a spinach salad - yum!
this was awesome everybody loved it would make again

I LOVE this recipe.
Comes out so tender every time. I thicken the gravy a little. My family loves it.
Best brisket I have ever made in the last 20 years
Totally void of flavor. I thought a long braise would infuse some but was wrong. Only did this as a trial run for the upcoming holidays. Will not be on any menu.
I loved this recipe and my family loved the meal. There was not 1 piece leftover

I followed the recipe as listed. I have not had a veggie burger in years; however, the reason why I rated only a three is because the texture was good but had to cook a little longer maybe because I used a Nutri bullet to chop veggie ingredients. Also, although I like cumin it was slightly taken over the other flavors in the burger. I did add swiss cheese and toped with Dijon mustard and a little sweet chili sauce. I do recommend to top veggie burger just like you would any other burger in order I believe to get a nice flavor and I did not use bread but I would take a sesame bun and place it in a skillet to get a slight buttery flavor which I believe will make this recipe a 5 star. If someone tries it with the bun and other stuff please let me know your opinion.

This recipe was utterly delicious. I used this for a 9 lb whole brisket on sale from Costco for $2 a pound and just tripled the recipe. I didn't have beef broth so I used vegetable broth and added two packets of onion soup mix. I also substituted tomato paste with more broth and more wine in place of the tomato sauce. I added garlic because that's a flavor we really love in our household.

Despite the size of the brisket, it came out amazingly tender, with plenty of delicious sauce. I sliced up the whole brisket, packaged it with sauce, and shared with friends. Everyone is loving it and asking for me to make it again.
I love this recipe, so does my husband. We love using this brisket in breakfast burritos. So yummy!

Oh so tender and good flavor! We had a small, lean brisket so laid bacon over top and put in the slow cooker instead of the oven about 5 hours on low. Made it a day ahead so it was easy to slice when cold and reheat with a gravy made from the remaining juices. I did saute the onion and de-glazed the pan with the broth, added the tomato sauce and wine and poured all over the brisket in the crock pot.
Surprisingly easy and equally delicious!
Only change I made was I added garlic. Sauce was excellent. My meat was not as tender as I had hoped for. I did use a slow cooker instead of the oven.

I live in a Asian country where finding a not rubber like beef is quite a task, so when I found some brisket on the market I didn't have any expectations. 
I chose this recipe cause I had wine at home and I like wine sauce with beef. Did change the recipe a little, was too lazy to saute the onions so added them raw to the baking pan, used tomato paste instead and found a lonely carrot in the fridge so I throw it in too....
When I took it out from the oven and tried it...Oh my , my, my...! it was so tender! I had not had a tender bite of beef in such a long time that I almost cried :). Perfect recipe! I will definitely do it again.

This was incredibly delicious. I read every where that if you want a tender brisket you have to smoke it for 12 hours or have it in the oven at low heat for 6 hours. I made this one in about three and half hours. When I took it out of the oven, I reduced the juices by half and poured a good amount to each serving. Served it with a side of cole slaw and mix of small potatoes. I did make a small change only because I forgot to buy the thyme so I replaced it with oregano and I added seasoned salt to the onions when I was cooking them. The red wine I used was Pinot noire. Everyone loved it, my aunt even suggested that we replace the ham at Christmas dinner with this wine braised brisket recipe. This recipe was easily doubled to accommodate a 7 1/2 pound brisket.

I made this dish for dinner last night, following the ingredients exactly. Not having a baking dish that could be used on top of the stove as well, I used a large, heavy non-stick skillet. I browned the meat, put it into a foil-lined baking dish, and then did the onions and added the other ingredients. I poured this into the baking dish, covered everything with foil, and put it in the oven for an hour, then basted the meat and put it back in the oven for 2 more hours. I had some concern about the temperature, but relied on the reviews. The meat was absolutely delicious, moist and cut-with-a-fork tender. Surprisingly, the union was outstanding too. My husband said it was as delicious a meat dish as he had ever had, and far surpassed any brisket he had ever been served. We had leftover brisket for lunch today, and it was excellent heated up. My husband says we'll be having brisket again soon now that "we" know such a great recipe. I'm fine with that since it was so good and so easy to make.
This is the BEST brisket I have ever tasted. So simple but the flavors give the dish such depth. The only thing I changed is I put my oven on 320 and cooked it for 3.5 hours. Thank you!
Made this weekend and it was awesome. I used a red cooking wine which was a little mild. Recommend something with a bit more kick. It was even better day two are marinating overnight.

This is a delicious recipe with great aroma that fulls the house, comfort food. I used sweet onion and red onion and 3 cloves of fresh crush garlic that i added to the onions as they cooked in my cast iron pot and used convection @350 for 2.5 hrs.
I'm often hesitant to make new things, but this was so good and my entire family loved it. Great recipie!!! Will make again!

First time making beef brisket. Instructions were easy to follow, I followed the recipe exactly. I loved it and so did all my guests. I bought a 4lb brisket and ended up with about 3lbs after removing the fat. My 8 year old who is so picky loved it as well. Definitely adding this to my dinner rotation.

This is AMAZING! Try this with Aimee's Mashed Cauliflower 'Potatoes', found here on Allrecipes for a healthier option that pairs wonderfully. Definitely my new favorite meal; hearty & super easy to make in the crock pot too! Sauté a clove of garlic & mushrooms too, if thats your thing!

I made this for Christmas. Larger slice of meat so had to double the recipie. It was amazing and a huge hit. The meat was tender flavorful and needless to say not much left for leftovers. I highly recommend this.
Holy Bambam! This is delicious. I made it exactly as recipe stated, except I threw in some garlic cloves. This was superb! thank you a zillion.
Delicious and super easy. My sauce never thickened but still great. Based on ingredients, not sure why this would ever thicken so curious about that. Thx for sharing.

Turned out as described. I cooked it in Le Creuset at 190 degrees F for 6 hours rather than higher temp for shorter time. I love doing that when braising. Only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that we were hoping for a tangier taste and should have picked a different recipe for that.

We love this! I make it just like he says but I do use a pot roast vs a brisket. The sauce is so flavorful. I make noodles or spaetzle to go with it, and we drizzle the sauce over that. I do it in a slow cooker on low for 10 hours. I have made this 5 times now and it will forever be in my stable of go-to recipes. Even my 4- year old and 2-year olds love it!

This is fantastic and easy. I had a larger brisket then what's listed, a 5 lb vs the 3. So I doubled the ingredients, except for the onion (I used white instead of red). I also added a half hour cooking time, so 3 hours total basting every hour. It was excellent, also added a little flour at the end to make the sauce a bit more of a gravy.
This brisket was very good. I normally smoke mine, but decided to try this way since I was short on time. A little on the salty side, but will definitely make this again.

Great recipe! I made it exactly as written except that I used white onions since I didn't have red in the house. My brisket was just under two pounds so I put in a little less beef stock. In other words, I only changed the recipe out of necessity. The recipe is perfect as is--tender and flavorful. The juice thickens up nicely while the brisket is roasting. A delicious and easy entree! Just add egg noodles or mashed potatoes and a salad and you're done.
This was my first time making brisket. I made it in the crock pot, set it to low when I left the house in the morning for work and it was super tender and juicy by dinner time.
Easy, smelled good, excellent for holiday meals. Made the whole thing in a large oven safe.frying pan. For a 2 lb brisket, cooked it only 2 hours but would probably do a little less next time
good to the end, made dinner, sandwiches, and stew to finish off the left overs.
Made the recipe as written. Was a perfect Sunday night supper. Would definitely make it again.
I didn't have a red onion, so I used what I had. thought this was delicious. I would make this again.
I made this as is,it was delicious. This is definitely a keeper.
I love this recipe. It makes my house smell heavenly when I cook it and tastes even better!

I made this a day ahead of time because I knew I would be pressed for time the next day. I used a 2 lb. brisket, but used the full amount of the other ingredients. I seared it on both sides as directed and removed it from the pan. Then I sautéed the onions for a couple of minutes and deglazed the pan with the beef broth, then stirred in the tomato sauce and wine. I returned the brisket to the pan on top of the onions and put it in the over at 350 degrees. After an hour I spooned some of the liquid and a lot of the onions over the top and returned it to a 300 degree oven. It seemed to have a lot of liquid at that point, but it does simmer down quite a bit. After a total of three hours I removed it from the oven and allowed it to cool somewhat, transferred it to another container and refrigerated it. The next morning I sliced the brisket and returned it to the refrig. Then, at dinnertime, I only had to reheat it and serve. Hubs liked this a lot, but I found it to be pretty greasy. It was probably my brisket, even though I sliced off a lot of fat from the bottom. I can see trying this with a pot roast next time. And I’ll add more onions. They seemed to disintegrate over the long cooking time.
I followed this recipe to a T. I really wanted to like it but it lacked flavor and was not tender. If I ever try it again, I would try it in a crock pot.
Didn't change a thing... and it was so tender and delicious. Thank you so much for sharing - what an easy and amazing recipe!!! family LOVED it!!

awesome recipe!! made this last night for a dinner party and everyone LOVED it. it was easy and very tender and juicy! my sides were mashed potatoes and garlic bread. mmmmmm.. i did add carrots and celery to the brisket as well. delish! thanks again!!

Made this two years in a row for Christmas. This year had the butcher cut a seven pound brisket in half for me, trim it down nicely into a 3.4 pound roast. Only alterationto the recipe was that I used cranberry wine instead. Everyone loved it and will definitely make this again.
